AITA for backing out of an engagement because she quit and won't work once they are married? A bit of backstory is needed to explain her mentality. Her father ran an extremely successful construction business that his father left to him in a large city. He regularly was winning multi million dollar construction bids and once he asked his now wife his fiancée's mother to marry him he told her to quit her job and that she wasn't going to work anymore.

Now to them, Nick is 28, she is 26 and they have been dating for about 3.5 years now. They both have student loan debt up to their eyes and the only reason they have a house is because her father gave her one about 2 years ago. There is no way they could afford a house right now (yay student loan debt and various credit card debt they both have.)

Her family is wealthy and her father is great but he also believes in making your own way, Nick respects that and is super grateful for what he has done so far with the house and bailing them out a few times when things got pretty bad.

So now to them, Nick proposed to her 2 months ago and it all was great. Both families like each other and they all get along great. However.. last week his wife to be told Nick she put in her two weeks notice and is extremely happy to finally be a wife and not work anymore... Uhh what? They had their first major fight right there because they need her income to survive especially if they are going to have a kid in a year or so like they plan to.

Nick is not on a position like her father was to fully support a family on his income alone, not to mention her debt piled on top of his. Also if she never planned to use her degree once she got married why did she take all the loans? Nick also found out she would have ZERO student loan debt if she went to what her father calls a "real school". She went to a local state college because her boyfriend at the time was going to go there even though she was accepted at other schools.

Now Nick is not going to argue her Dad's an ass to pay for college at one school and not the other or blame her for wanting to be by a boyfriend at the time and taking student loans to go be by him. That's the past and when you think you are in love or are in love you do some stupid things sometimes.

However Nick cannot marry her if she honestly just won't work now that she's a wife. Nick gets that it's her mother's kind of fairy tale that happened to her but Nick is not wealthy enough to do that. They talked about doing that for 3-4 years once they have a kid because Nick does believe that a child should always have one parent around and not just daycare/babysitters because daycare is extremely expensive. Then once their kid gets into Pre-K she would return to work part time then full-time once school actually starts.

Now apparently that plan they had is moot and her new plan is to never work again because Nick popped the question. Not cool and her mom is FULLY behind her decision, the Dad is way more level headed and took Nick out to drink and told Nick there will be no bad feelings if Nick backs out because Nick shouldn't be expected to do that unless Nick is in a financial position to do so.

AITA if Nick gives her an ultimatum to work or not get married? Nick also doesn't want to get married on the back of an ultimatum, he just doesn't see that being healthy either.

AITA for Nick not wanting to look after his autistic younger cousin? |

Some background, his cousin is 16 and Nick is 20. Nick has always been fond of his cousin, they used to be really close, people would joke about them being brother and sister.

So, last week Nick's uncle called his mum to say that his aunt (who was a recovering alcoholic) had started drinking again and she's not getting out of bed, not showering, not helping to look after his cousin etc... and Nick just felt this immediate sense of dread because this same thing happened before. When Nick was 17 his nan got that same exact call, Nick offered to go with her to check up on his aunt and they ended up coming back with his cousin. Nick was pretty happy at first, he wasn't seeing much of his cousin at the time so it was nice to be able to spend time with him.

After a while, Nick realised that his mum had agreed to let him stay at their place while his uncle was trying to get help for his aunt in the hopes that Nick would be the one looking after him. Nick's mum was working full-time and his sister was away for the summer with a club, which left Nick as the obvious candidate as he was on his summer holidays. Nick didn't mind at first, it was nice having his cousin around but looking after him meant that Nick had to be with him all the time. Nick had to take him to the park, Nick had to bring him with him to hospital and dentist appointments (Nick was late in his recovery from surgery so he had a lot of follow-up appointments). From when his cousin woke up at about 5 in the morning until Nick's mum got home from work at 7, Nick had to be watching him. Nick couldn't go out with friends, couldn't even have friends over otherwise his cousin would kick up a fuss. The only alone time Nick had was at night which is when he likes to go on his laptop, listen to music, do some writing but by that time he was too tired to do any of that. There were times when Nick would catch him masturbating, not even accidentally walking in on him but his cousin would do it in the open in the living room, would shove his hands down his pants when they were out in public. Nick would tell him not to do it, he would say sorry but carry on.

That was Nick's whole summer. He was stressed, he was missing out on a lot and he was missing his friends, his mum kept telling him that it wasn't for long, that they were doing it for his aunt. His cousin was here for over 6 weeks. That's the experience that turned Nick off of wanting to look after him again.

Nick's mum got in touch, told him it's happening again and if he can come home for a week or so to help look after his cousin. Nick just straight up told her no. He's older now, he's living away from home, he's a student working part-time with amazing friends. He told her that he has a life of his own now, he can't just drop everything and come home to look after his cousin. She got really upset with him and told him he's being selfish because she has to work and look after his sister (who's now the same age Nick was when the responsibilty was dumped on him). Nick told her that it's not fair to just expect him to do it and then hung up on her. He's been trying to forget about it but a part of him feels bad.

Is Nick the asshole?

AITA for Nick being pissed off at his mom's boyfriend and expecting him to ask to watch tv? | Nick's mom has been with her boyfriend around 6-7 years, they fight most of the time and every so often they have massive blow-up fights that get ugly. They fight about the same things all the time and it's just a vicious, repetitive cycle. They become verbally abusive to each other and have gotten physical in the past.

In the 3 months Nick had been living with them, maybe 4-5 times Nick had been watching tv when the boyfriend came home. He usually gets home around 4:30 but sometimes shows up whenever. One night around 7:30 Nick's mom and Nick were sitting in the kitchen and Nick put a hockey game on, the boyfriend came home, didn't say anything to either of them, walked to the couch, picked up the remote and changed the channel without even asking if they were watching anything. Another time Nick was off work for the day and it was 2 in the afternoon and the boyfriend came home and went upstairs for the rest of the night apparently because Nick was watching tv, but if he said he wanted to watch Nick would have let him have the tv. Nick's sister made a huge deal that Nick was in the boyfriend's space and shouldn't be watching tv, and Nick's mom said whenever the boyfriend comes home Nick should just go to the basement. Nick said it's unfair that everyone should have to bend to the boyfriend's will just because he gets upset at the smallest things, and he could just say he wanted to watch tv and Nick would have no problem. Nick's mom agreed with Nick that the boyfriend was being ridiculous and rude, and Nick said he would not let the boyfriend get whatever he wants just because he's a baby about it.

So fast forward a bit and the 2 of them were fighting again and the boyfriend called Nick's mother a whore among other things, Nick guesses his tv watching was somehow a part of it as well. They got into a massive fight when Nick was out of the house for an entire day, Nick's mom said she ripped his shirt and the dog gate to the kitchen was smashed and she told Nick Nick had gotten his wish because the boyfriend might never be coming back. Shame on Nick for thinking his mom had finally come to her senses because it lasted about 2 1/2 weeks and then a couple days ago she told Nick he was coming back and all of a sudden was framing it like Nick watching tv was the only reason they had fought and Nick was the issue. Nick told his mom he was just not going to up and leave whenever the boyfriend got home, and if the boyfriend wanted the tv and Nick was watching something, then he could say so and Nick would have no issue. Apparently this was way out of line on Nick's end and now Nick's mom was telling the boyfriend she hated Nick, that Nick was lazy and Nick deserved nothing. Nick was really confused by this 180 because she had no problem agreeing with what Nick said 2 weeks prior, but now her and Nick's sister were painting Nick as the villain.

That morning the boyfriend tried to tell Nick that what him and Nick's mom had was "different" and that he cares for her deeply, and Nick could use whatever he wanted, but to understand that it's his space. Nick told him "Nick doesn't care for you because you called Nick's mother a whore" and left, he hadn't said anything to Nick since and Nick's mom hadn't spoken to Nick since he came back and Nick was left wondering how he was the bad guy.

So AITA?

AITA for abandoning Nick's friend and her kids? Nick had a friend who was renting a house and was going to need a new roommate soon, as long as Nick was ok couch surfing for the first month since Nick just lost his apartment due to money issues after losing his full time job. It was $800 a month for a room in the basement and a private bathroom. That included utilities and internet. Only other stipulation is she would need help feeding her kids (13f & 15m) here and there.

While Nick worked 2 jobs Nick wasn’t exactly rolling in dough as both jobs weren’t great. As time goes on Nick goes from feeding her kids sometimes to being the one to feed them and if Nick didn’t then they may not eat. It got worse to the point where Nick was working 2 physically demanding jobs on less than 1000 calories worth of food a day. Nick was literally starving and trying to push what Nick could to feed the kids. Nick worked his ass off trying to find a better job and was able to get something finally.

Suddenly the person paying the internet bill decided he wanted to move out with little warning and it fell to Nick to take care of it. When he came back he never took it back over. So now Nick is paying close to $900 a month plus a massive food bill. Nick's sister has been asking Nick if Nick wants to live with her because she knows Nick has been in a bad way and Nick's depression is getting worse since Nick could no longer afford therapy. April rolls around and it’s time to renew the lease, the roommate who invited Nick is lamenting she wants to move out but is trying to find someone to take her spot. At this point she has been out of work due to TIA and FM and claims she can’t afford rent anymore. Nick says let’s sit down and look at the bills and see what’s can be done to balance things out for her and that’s when the other shoe drops.

The whole time she has been paying about $600 a month for three bedrooms (the house has 5 bedrooms), one for her with a private bathroom and 1 each for the kids. She made as much as Nick did before being on disability so why was Nick paying $300 more than anyone in the house on top of food costs for two teenagers? Add on the fact that she has Ipsy, other subscription boxes and constantly getting packages from Amazon but can’t feed her own kids even the basics.

Nick says nothing but decides since it turns out Nick was never added to the lease Nick can go whenever. Nick talks to his sister and they plan for Nick to move in at the end of June. Once the date is set Nick lets his roommate know she has a little more than 2 1/2 months to find someone to take over Nick's spot and Nick needed to get himself on track to getting out on his own again. She is mad Nick would leave them in the lurch like this even though Nick gave her so much time find someone else to move in.

Come October she lets Nick know she and the others were abandoning the house. Nick knows she blames Nick moving out for the upheaval (they did find someone else to take Nick's room but they weren’t willing to take the extra responsibilities). So is Nick the asshole for moving out knowing she wasn’t going to feed her kids and lose the house?

AITA For Nick Wanting to Cut His Sister Out of His Life? | Nick is 31 and his sister is 38 and lives with his parents. Things really started to come to a head about 4 years ago when Nick's oldest son was born. He was 2 weeks early and the doctors wanted him to stay in the NICU (ultimately for about 10 days). Nick and his wife decided that they didn't want anyone to visit at the hospital because among other things it was very overwhelming. Nick's sister then proceeds to guilt Nick into letting her make him host them at Nick and his wife's house while Nick's wife stays at the hospital. During said visit Nick's sister (who didn't have a serious boyfriend) says to Nick that she is really jealous of Nick and his wife. Nick felt this was kind of inappropriate but decided to let it pass.

Now Nick's sister lives with Nick's parents rent free with her son.

Fast forward to fall of last year, and Nick's parents decided that they were going to sell their RV trailer because they needed a bigger one so Nick's sister and her son could come with them. Nick and his wife had been looking for an RV trailer for a while and offered to buy it, matching the highest offer they had been given thus far. Nick and his wife decided to keep the trailer at Nick's parents house over winter. Come March, Nick and his wife discovered she was pregnant. They decided that since it would be difficult to have a toddler and 2 infants in the trailer, they should sell the trailer and use the money as a down payment on a minivan. Nick told his parents and his sister this plan and Nick's sister offers to sell it for them so they don't have to bother bringing it to their home several hours away.

Nick's sister sold the trailer for double and transfers Nick the money but it's only what they paid for the trailer initially. Nick asks her why she isn't giving him the whole amount, she says they got the family discount. Nick brings this up to his parents who tell him that his sister needs the money and he should just drop it. Nick is angry but decides it's not worth it since his parents are clearly on her side.

It seems fairly insignificant but Disney plus comes out and Nick has 2 newborns at home and his sister calls him up and tells him that he needs to share their Disney plus password and tells him that he owes her his password since he used to use their netflix while he was in college. When Nick said no they got upset and called him ungrateful and said he was taking advantage of his parents.

Almost 2 months later Nick's mother won't speak to him, because of "how he treated her and his sister". Nick's sister has called and berated him for upsetting her and his mother and called him ungrateful and things that would make a sailor blush.

Nick finally decided that he was going to cut her out of his life when his dad calls and says that even though Nick doesn't own "all the blame" he needs to get over it and make up with his sister, because he and Nick's mother were upset they had yet to visit Nick's twins despite them being almost 3 months old. When Nick explained to him that the 2 of them were more than welcome to visit anytime they wanted, he told Nick that they were a family and if she wasn't welcome, they weren't coming without her.

AITA for Nick wanting to cut his sister out of his life?

Is Judy the asshole for not aligning with Judy's in-law’s expectations of gender roles and asking Judy's husband to stay home when their sitter calls off? | Backstory: Judy's FIL and Judy's husband are EQUAL business partners of a collision shop. Judy's FIL is the lead when it comes to “back of the house” and Judy's husband is the lead in “front of the house.” They also have two employees working for them, so everything runs real smoothly there and even if someone doesn’t show up, the shop can still run efficiently.

Judy works as a graphic designer in a VERY small vehicle wrap and sign shop with a total of 3 employees including Judy herself. Judy gets paid well, Judy gets a lot of leniency when it comes to anything at the shop. Basically, Judy can do what Judy wants as Judy's job is getting done during business hours. Judy spent years on a degree, which Judy admits Judy did not need, however, Judy is so proud of Judy's work and Judy loves Judy's job. The shop falls behind if Judy doesn’t get Judy's tasks completed.

Judy and Judy's husband had their first/last baby in May 2019. Judy decided to return PART TIME after maternity leave despite the need for Judy to come back full time. If Judy crams an entire weeks worth of work into Monday through Wednesday Judy still fills the position effectively and Judy is still valued. This lets Judy stay home Thursday and Friday without the worry of childcare. Judy's mother watches their baby otherwise because she asked to. Well, while Judy really appreciates Judy's mom, she is super flaky, Judy expected her to be. She’s good for canceling 2-3 times a month on Judy. So Judy actually has 2 backup sitters, because if Judy misses a day of work Judy sets the whole shop back.

Forward to their recent family debate, argument and eventually Judy's blow-up: TWICE NOW all three of Judy's sitters have been unavailable and it has come down to Judy or Judy's husband staying home with their kid. Judy's husband wouldn’t mind staying home, he’s not the problem. Judy's FIL straight up looked Judy in the face and said to Judy, “you are the woman and the mother, it is your responsibility to stay home if you do not have a sitter.” Judy is sorry but Judy doesn’t feel this way. Judy told Judy's FIL as nicely as Judy could that Judy's husband chose to make this baby too and it was also Judy's husband's responsibility. Judy's FIL literally laughed in Judy's face and that’s what pissed Judy off... Judy argued with Judy's FIL that they are living in fucking 2020 and that Judy's FIL's beliefs on gender roles are fucking stupid. Judy already (and happily) misses out on two days of work. Judy needs to be reliable for the other three days Judy is scheduled to be there so that Judy is not replaced. Judy's husband can’t be fired from Judy's husband's own business and it’s not like Judy and Judy's husband lose money if Judy's husband takes a day off occasionally on the freak occurrence that all 3 sitter options are unavailable. Judy screamed at Judy's FIL that Judy was sacrificing a lot for Judy's child but Judy wasn’t going to give up something Judy loves so much. Judy called Judy's FIL an asshole as Judy's FIL shook Judy's FIL's head and Judy slammed the door. Nothing like this has ever happened, Judy's FIL has been very supportive the whole 10 years Judy has been apart of the family but this seems like a no-brainer to Judy.

Is Judy the asshole for not taking Judy's FIL’s gender role bullshit and asking Judy's husband to stay home with their child when their child care options fail, instead of Judy?

AITA for unintentionally causing a girl to lose her babysitting job? | FF = Family friends

CB = Careless Babysitter

So, Nick and his family are staying at FFs house because their wedding is tomorrow, and they've been here for about 5 days. FFs have 3 kids, who are extremely misbehaved and they're a lot to handle. Nick is also sick, so that adds even more difficulty to the situation.

For the majority of the time Nick has been here, Nick has been babysitting the three kids and his siblings by Nick while FFs and his parents prepare for the wedding. The kids as Nick said are very misbehaved, and they prompt the other two to act up as well. They scream, argue, cry, and generally don't listen to Nick when Nick tells them to do anything. FFs have a gym set that they're not allowed to climb on, and because they don't listen when Nick tells them to get off, Nick has to run back and forth to actually pick them up off the equipment. They get his brother, who has ADHD riled up as well, and then his brother encourages his sister to join in, so Nick ends up having to control five misbehaving children who don't listen to Nick whatsoever.

When FFs came home Nick explained the situation to them and they said that they would get another babysitter to help Nick out with the kids when they go out for dinner. Nick was incredibly thankful. They went out for dinner and CB showed up. The first thing she did was drop her bag in the middle of the living room and sit down on her phone. The kids were going wild as always but this time it was literally happening all around her and she was doing nothing to stop it. This carried on the entire night, and not once did she step in to help. She actually found out that Nick was sick around halfway through the night because she came upstairs to use the bathroom while Nick was up there vomiting. Nick kinda hoped she would start helping Nick after seeing that Nick was unwell, but she continued to ignore the chaos going on around her and ultimately left Nick to do all the work.

Nearing the end of the night, Nick asked CB to help Nick get the oldest child to go to sleep. He wouldn't listen to Nick at all. He just screamed at the top of his lungs and threw a tantrum on his bed. She told Nick she'd be up in a minute and that she was just facetiming her friend real quick. Nick was angered and Nick knew she wasn't gonna do anything, so Nick managed to get him to bed himself.

FFs come home, and talk to CB. They then pay CB $100 for "babysitting" their kids, and Nick got nothing. So before she left, Nick told them Nick had actually done everything, and added that she knew Nick wasn't feeling well but still left all the work up to Nick. She called Nick an ass and told Nick that Nick only ratted her out because Nick was "entitled" and "wanted her money." It has some truth to it Nick guesses because Nick didn't think it'd be fair if Nick was the one working Nick's ass off but yet got nothing while the one who sat on her ass got paid. They ended up asking the kids the next morning if CB paid attention to them, all of which said no. They apologized to Nick and called CB's parents to tell them that she was fired. Now Nick feels at fault. AITA?

AITA for not paying Nick's aunt's phone bill? | For most of Nick's life, his aunt has a difficult time listening to Nick. If Nick's upset about how she's talking to him and voices it, she brushes it off and says Nick's being too sensitive. If Nick's telling a story, she'll interrupt and ask something that had already been said.

If Nick tells her not to give bad foods to the dogs, she'll go ahead and do it behind Nick's back. Nick's mom has had 4 strokes in the last 6 years, and Nick has been trying to get her to eat healthy. Every 6 months is a conversation about not buying french fries, soda, etc. Just recently, Nick's mom had a check up where her cholesterol was through the roof, and Nick had a conversation again about not buying all that crap. When Nick confronts his aunt about it, she says that "it's only one time". It stops for a while, and then it continues. She also listens to other people before Nick, even though Nick has backed up his POV with facts and sources.

Sunday was Nick's mom's birthday, and Nick told his aunt a week before to buy a vanilla cake from a specific store because Nick's mom likes their vanilla cakes. Nick also tells her not to buy bad food. She agrees. Sunday comes and she calls Nick from another store asking what flavor. Nick says vanilla, but that isn't the store Nick told her to go to. She says that she had plans for that day and she wasn't going to go out of her way to go to some other store to get a cake. Nick responds by saying that he had told her a week ago and that she said agreed to it, and her response was that Nick's overreacting.

When she came home, she has the cake, along with a bag of french fries and soda. Nick asks her about it. She says that it's only for her birthday, and Nick says that that's why the cake was allowed. Plus, Nick had asked her not to buy other crap. She waves Nick off.

Later on, after they've sung happy birthday, Nick sees his aunt sneakily giving Nick's dog cake, using her body to block Nick's view. Nick tells her that she's going to kill Nick's dog. And she says that Nick's just overreacting. Nick just went to his room, and slammed the door closed.

Every time she doesn't listen to Nick, it gets increasingly worse. It went from being civil, to Nick making petty and shady comments, to just screaming and now slamming things.

So Nick decided to no longer give her money. Monday, Nick's mom and aunt were talking about his aunt's phone service. It had been cut off because she didn't pay the $80. Today, while Nick's at work and more inclined to say yes to things because he doesn't want attention, Nick's mom calls. She asks if Nick can pay for his aunt's phone bill, and Nick says no. When Nick tried to explain to her why, his mom interrupts Nick and starts saying that she was Nick's aunt and family. Nick tells her that he's trying to say why and she's not letting Nick. Nick's mom ignores it and asks if Nick was going to pay for the bill, and Nick says no. She said thank you and hung up on Nick.

**TL;DR**: Nick doesn't want to pay for his aunt's phone bill because Nick feels like she's not treating him with enough respect to value how Nick feels and thinks.

Is Nick the asshole here?

WIBTA if Nick took his Netflix away from his parents and deleting his Spotify account for them stealing his Spotify? | Throwaway for Nick's AITA posts. 15 Male for context, so sorry if Nick makes high school level grammatical errors and such. Also for later in the story, keep in mind Nick's mother has his e-mail monitored so she can see whatever e-mail Nick receives. Nick has always loved music, tv, and movies. So both Netflix and Spotify are no-brainers for a guy like Nick. Nick decided to cut a deal with his parents (in 2017 when he got it) and make it so that when he worked at his volunteer job, they would pay him minimum wage (USD 7.25). The first thing Nick decided to spend his well-earned money on was a Spotify Premium subscription. The counter was that it would have to be billed from his parent's bank account for the time being as Nick is not legally allowed to open one in his state due to the fact he is under 16. Nick's parents accepted the offer and so they subtracted $15 from his monthly wage to pay for his Spotify as time continued.

Nick's grandparents are cool as far as grandparents go. They love video games, music, movies, and all of the other things Nick likes. Eventually, in 2018, they decided to get a Netflix subscription for them and Nick. Soon, Nick decided to ask his grandparents if he could put the account on to his parent's tv service so his family and he could watch anything they so desired, they accepted to his surprise. Nick, therefore, did what he got permission to do and put their account on to his parent's living room TV so they could watch more media.

Fast forward to now, Nick's mother ends up changing his Spotify password so she can use it to listen to music in the car(even though she has been perfectly content with using the radio for years!). Nick doesn't mind the fact that she wants to listen to music, but he pays for that with his own money and her taste in music and his are very different (Nick likes old stuff from the 1930s all the way to the 1980s while she prefers the stuff most people listen to nowadays, which is not the kind of thing Nick can stand to listen to{not to offend anyone}). Also, she listens to it ALL DAY and Spotify only allows your account to be used once at a time. So now Nick keeps getting recommended rap music, his friends keep questioning his apparent change in taste of music, and he can't listen to music on his account as his mother keeps stealing it. Whenever Nick talks to her about it, she says that she pays for it so she gets to use it. Which is not true!^^

(Side note: they also are annoyed Nick won't give them the password to the Netflix so they can use it on their other devices)

So, Nick has been thinking, and he believes he has a fair plan. Nick's grandparents are fine with him paying them money to support his Spotify account until he can get a bank account. So Nick personally sees it fit to delete his Spotify account, start a new personal e-mail to run a new one and other services off of, and delete the Netflix from the Living Room TV. Does this seem a fair punishment to them after he has asked them to stop using something he pays for and they get greedy with the Netflix they don't own? WIBTA if he did this?

AITA for snapping at Judy's father for refusing to take care of the dog he got? | Judy's father recently got a puppy a month ago, about 5 months old for Judy's oldest daughter. He had mentioned to Judy and her husband before he wanted to get her a pet dog because according to him "it would calm her down "every kid needs a dog" "its the best thing for her" "she'll love me for this!" blah blah... Judy could go on and on about his convincing speech. Judy should also mention that Judy's father lives with Judy and her husband at the moment and yes he helps with bills. Judy asked him "I'm on board if you help watch the puppy and pitch in, it's basically your dog after all.." He swore up and down he'd help out, by taking it on walks etc. So fast forward, he gets Judy's daughter a cute female cockapoo. Judy's daughter is overjoyed, cuddles and kisses the damn thing constantly. Sometimes Judy and her husband have to pry the dog off Judy's daughter so she can eat and go to sleep. Both Judy's husband and Judy got all the essentials out of their own pockets. Dog crate, food, puppy pads, shampoo, treats, brush, lysol and paper towels to clean up the messes...omg the messes..ugh...
Everything good right? Wrong...because lets just say this entire month Judy's father showed his true colors. He refuses to take her out because "ugh i'm too old for this shit, she's too hyper for me to walk her..." Judy and her husband are the ONLY ones who take her on walks and clean up her poop and pee when she goes indoors. It mostly falls on Judy because Judy stays at home while Judy's husband works. Judy is the one who feeds her, cleans when she knocks down their trash can. The one who has to get her away from things she tries to eat...the one who needs to be with her at all times because he got a puppy with separation anxiety... and at night she jumps on Judy and her husband's bed because if they leave her out in her crate she barks and cries like crazy and no one can sleep. Judy's father sleeps like a rock all night meanwhile Judy gets up at 2 am every night with an alarm to allow the puppy to pee and poo so it doesnt go on their bed. Judy keeps telling Judy's self Judy is doing it for Judy's daughter...Judy is doing this for her....Judy is doing this for her....

Well, today what set Judy off was that its the first day of school for Judy's daughter. Judy is in a rush and getting her stuff when Judy's father, who was sprawled out on the sofa watching tv yells out "THE DOG POOED!" Judy was holding the door, Judy's daughter already outside, Judy turns to him and goes "SO CLEAN IT!" He stared at Judy in disbelief and starts achingly getting up groaning the entire time. He starts muttering "I'm going to return this thing..im too old for this shit, you will see" The thought of him returning the dog, Judy's daughter's dog who she adores more than life itself. Judy snapped and told him "YOURE SUCH A LAZY ASSHOLE, YOU REALLY CAN'T PICK UP SHIT FOR ONE DAMN DAY?!" He goes "WHERE'S THE WIPES FOR THIS?!" And Judy screams back "YOU HAD A WHOLE MONTH TO FIGURE OUT WHERE THE WIPES ARE!"
He's now telling people Judy is disrespectful because Judy yelled at him to clean up "her daughter's dog" Judy is livid. Judy is also tired and regrets ever letting him get the dog. Does Judy even have a right to be this upset?

Nick was an asshole for asking for repayment after supporting everyone for 5 months? |

In September Nick's partner was in an accident. A week later the partner came home and absolutely demanded Nick sell Nick's car. The partner was extremely clear that it was to be sold. Nick's car was definitely running but not in the best shape of its life. But Nick was still driving it. And Nick had been going back and forth about weather Nick wanted to sell or fix. Nick was currently on wanting to fix, even going as far as asking the partner how hard it would be to fix themselves, watching a few videos about it, and looking at prices for parts. The partner was aware of Nick's feelings, Nick involved the partner totally.

Well exactly one day after selling Nick's beloved car the partner comes home and tells Nick the partner was not able to work anymore as the partner was in too much pain. Nick was not aware the partner was in that much pain as the partner made no effort to get looked at prior to this convo. The partner said the partner had been in similar pain for years and made no effort to get checked out before all this despite having excellent health coverage.
